184547878.review:
Puto perro juegazo, lo siento pero no puedo encontrar otras palabras más precisas y suaves para expresar esta joya.

Eres una pobre persona (posiblemente endeudada) que decidió tomar una decisión (como el pico, por cierto) de unirse a las fuerzas de ''Alterra'', una empresa dedicada a la exploración y explotación de recursos naturales y de todo tipo en zonas extraterrestes, alejadísimas de la tierra que todos conocemos.
La nave donde vas tiene un ''accidente'' (si lo juegas, descubrirás la verdad) que te fuerza a vivir en una balsa en la superficie del mar en esta zona desconocida y completamente aterradora al inicio.
Eres un ser vivo, un humano concretamente, y tienes las necesidades de uno mismo, por lo que tendrás que salir de esta cápsula salvavidas segura a buscar recursos para generar agua y también cazar pecesitos extraterrestes para comer.

Puedes cazar, construir tu base y también construir poderosos vehículos como también puedes hacer otro tipo de cosas, como por ejemplo ir a explorar lugares recónditos, con misterios, restos de tus compañeros de equipo, pero apresúrate, porque las aguas están contaminadas de una enfermedad desconocida, que no sabes los efectos que tendrá en tu salud.

184543528.review:
Subnautica blends exploration and survival perfectly. The underwater world is stunning, and it's a thrilling, immersive experience that keeps you hooked from start to finish.

However, I do wish there was a map—having one would have made my experience much smoother. Also, I didn’t enjoy reading all the PDAs; a bit more direction on where to explore next would have been helpful. I get that it's an exploration game, but maybe adding different modes that offer more guidance would improve it.

One big downside was how hard it was to resist looking at the wiki. Unfortunately, I ended up seeing spoilers by some guides, which really impacted the experience. So, be careful if you decide to search for help! BUT...I needed it.

184488370.review:
Сейчас без шуток, я обожаю эту игру, для меня это как Dying Light - я могу проходить Subnautica хоть каждый год, игра затягивает геймплеем, увлекает сюжетом и лором, а также подбешивает менеджментом ресурсов, но это настолько не важно, что на это и вовсе можно закрыть глаза.

Единственное, что мне во многом не понравилось - это животные класса левиафан, ибо меня и мой транспорт они почти не трогали, дошло до того, что в активной лавовой зоне (пред финальной локации) самый страшный левиафан в игре - дракон-левиафан, вместо того чтобы свой огромной пастью сожрать мой Циклоп, просто начал его толкать, то есть со стороны изначально опасных мобов агрессии было минимум, а у более - менее дружелюбных (таких как, например, Сталкеров) агрессия была, по ощущениям, выкручена на максимум, каждый раз когда я мимо них проплывал они пытались меня укусить.

И на взаимодействии Циклопа и левиафанов я бы хотел акцентировать побольше внимания, ведь, как мне кажется, их взаимодействие - это некая синергия. Когда ты впервые создаешь Циклоп, ты думаешь что тебя уже никому не победить, ведь он довольно величественен по сравнению с Мотыльком и костюмом "КРАБ", однако при первой же встрече с кем - то из левиафанов весь твой пыл быстренько уходит, ведь твою подлодку грызут только так, и ты быстро оказываешься среди обломков своей субмарины где - то на дне океана, у меня же, в свою очередь, такого и близко не было, я думал что буду с поджатым хвостом и обосраными штанами убегать от этих огромных чудовищ, а казалось, что они боятся меня не меньше, чем я их.

Также спасибо МС-ПЕС (МС-ПСУ) за то что согласился устроить марафон, дело в том что игру он купил довольно давно, а проходить "не было мотивации", поэтому я предложил ему проходить её одновременно, чтобы так сказать замотивировать, в итоге на сороковой день у него в распоряжении весь транспорт игры, а также нахождение в неактивной лавовой зоне (насколько я помню он даже до вулканического замка не добрался), а я прошел игру уже на пятидесятый день, и очень сильно сомневаюсь, что ему удастся также, в общем, мотивация больше замотивировала меня, чем собственно человека, для которого я эту игру и проходил.

Если любите выживалки с сюжетом - настоятельно рекомендую, даже после нескольких прохождений она не перестаёт увлекать (я прошел игру уже три раза, на пиратке, на консоли, и вот, на лицензии).

40+ hours in and I love it so far.  Exploration and crafting, and some cool world-building being hinted at.   
 The scenery is gorgeous.  What's not to like?  

Well, inventory management is a bit of a hassle, but I think that will probably get better when I have better facilities.  

The graphics are really nice.  It looks lovely on my mid-range graphics card.  

There's some really nice world-building, and lots of secrets to unlock.  It's a perfect recipe for a game for me. 

I'm stoked to see such a fun game that's something other than "shoot all the guys".

This game is exceptionally well polished, and clearly a work of passion.

184455416.review: Playing survival mode involves a huge amount of grinding. Gave up early on and played in creative mode. Plenty to see and do, plenty of lore to read. Engaging and immersive environment.  Construction of equipment was unrealistic however, appearing by magic as it were.  Hostiles can mostly be ignored in creative mode which suits me being averse to constant combat.  For a person with a phobia of diving in the real world this was surprisingly manageable even therapeutic. Marker beacons were a huge help in find ones way around. Buildings are excessively large requiring much time to walk around for little reward, but enhancing the atmosphere of the story line.

184409320.review: Эти 40 часов были незабываемыми. Я уже знал как пройти ее до конца, но часов на 15 задержался чисто ради исследования мира, постройки всех возможных элементов базы и сбора всех записей кпк. Игра достаточно хардкорно ведет по сюжету, местами оставляя между сюжетными точками пропасти, которые придется пройти самому. Что мне понравилось в этой игре, то что ты действительно должен обладать нехилым запасом самоуверенности, чтобы предпринять вылазку в неизвестный биом. Между этими рывками решимости ты вполне можешь отвлечься на парочку часов чтобы уютно обставить базу, поесть бесполезных чипсов и поспать, чтобы узнать, что за невиданная херь вылупляется там в твоем аквариуме. Заканчивая игру мне реально было жаль оставлять все накопленное, выращенное и отстроенное мной добро, но это всего лишь еще одна крутая эмоция, которую эта игра позволяет пережить. Люблю сабнавтику всей душой. Про белоу зиро я не знаю вообще ничего и попробую пройти ее по олдскульному без каких либо подсказок из интернетов. Хоть ее и хвалят меньше первой, уверен, что это будет еще одно удивительное приключение.

184396072.review:
La verdad es un muy buen juego. Es el primer survival en agua, algo único y chingón. Aunque han pasado años desde su lanzamiento, sigue siendo excelente. Jugué muchas horas y disfruté las mecánicas innovadoras.

Aspectos Positivos

Jugabilidad:
Las mecánicas son geniales y el diseño del mundo submarino es impresionante.
Todo está bastante balanceado, desde los recursos hasta las herramientas.

Emoción y Exploración:
Aunque los leviatanes no me asustaron personalmente, para un jugador casual pueden ser intimidantes.
El concepto de supervivencia en agua está muy bien ejecutado.

Mods y Rejugabilidad:
La posibilidad de agregar mods y el próximo multijugador en Subnautica 2 me emociona mucho.


Aspectos Negativos

Bugs:
Problemas con el Prawn Suit:
Cuando intentas salir del agua, las físicas no funcionan bien, lo que es molesto.
A veces parece más pesado de lo normal, y quedarse atascado es frustrante.
En la parte de la emperatriz, recoger ciertos objetos es complicado.

Faltas en el diseño:
Sería genial que el Prawn Suit pudiera volar un poco más alto sobre la superficie del agua sin necesidad de usar el gancho como Spider-Man.

Faltas de optimización:
El juego necesita mejorar en optimización y arreglar algunos bugs irritantes.


Experiencia Personal

Retomé el juego recientemente porque quiero prepararme para Subnautica 2.
Aunque consume tiempo, es muy satisfactorio.
La curva de aprendizaje es algo empinada, ya que debes leer mucho para entender las mecánicas.

Calificación Final
Le doy una puntuación entre 8.6 y 8.9. Es un juego impresionante con detalles que aún pueden mejorarse, pero lo recomendaría totalmente, especialmente a quienes disfruten de la exploración y la supervivencia.

Obwohl das Spiel schon länger auf dem Markt ist und ich es bereits auf einer anderen Plattform gespielt habe, entdecke ich immer wieder neue Details. Die Atmosphäre des Spiels ist hervorragend und sorgt dafür, dass sich nach und nach eine unterschwellige Panik entwickelt. 184378752.review:
Subnautica — это невероятное приключение, которое погружает вас в подводный мир, полный тайн и удивительных существ. Игра сочетает в себе элементы выживания, исследования и строительства, создавая уникальный опыт, который невозможно забыть.

Графика в игре просто потрясающая! Каждый подводный пейзаж выглядит как произведение искусства, а звуковое оформление создает атмосферу глубокой бездны. Вы будете замирать от восторга, когда увидите, как светит биолюминесцентная флора или как величественно плавают огромные существа.

Что касается игрового процесса, то он очень увлекательный. Вам предстоит исследовать океан, собирать ресурсы, строить базы и, конечно же, избегать опасностей. Я не раз находил себя смеющимся в голос, когда пытался увернуться от агрессивных рыбок, которые, казалось, просто ждали момента, чтобы напасть на меня!

Смешные моменты: Однажды, когда я пытался собрать ресурсы на дне океана, я случайно наткнулся на огромного жнеца ливеафана. Мой первый инстинкт был — убежать, но вместо этого я запутался в водорослях и, как настоящий герой, начал паниковать! Это был момент, когда я понял, что подводный мир полон сюрпризов

184343359.review: Вообще я решил написать обзор после того как прошел The Forest, но наверное мне и объяснять не надо было, что Subnautica - шедевр. Я нисколько не жалею, что купил её, прошел ни раз и всё ещё возвращаюсь к ней(хоть уже и не часто). Это одна из лучших игр, в которые я играл. Эта игра вселяет страх в тебя, но в то же время ты наслаждаешься этим процессом. Лор у игры просто ахеренный, даже связанный со второй не такой успешной частью(она хреновая, поэтому я её не купил). Локации, транспорт, разные механики каждого транспорта - ахуенные, особенно локации(даже те, что "уродливы", они так сделаны специально, наверное, чтобы вселять страх в тех, кто забрел туда, куда не нужно было(по крайней мере в горы, в редкий риф придется залезать..)). Звуковая составляющая что-то с чем-то, музыку писал гений, звуки на фоне я даже описать не могу. Бывает просто плывешь и тебя передернет от тех же рифоспинов или газобрюха. Левиафаны тоже просто разъеб, друзья мои, не буду ничего говорить про них, на всякий случай, вдруг кто-то не знает... Ну мне как любителю дрочилок еще нравится процесс ходьбы туда-сюда за тем-сем, со временем прохождений раз за разом я допер, что можно делать фермы, а блондится по карте все равно приходится)). Особенно всегда пробирает до мурашек концовка. Все в этой игре гениально. Обожаю субнатику. Жаль, что при первом прохождении много в вики глядел и у одного друга расспрашивал, хотя так я наверное до сих пор бы долбился в глубину 500м. Покупайте короче - вот и вся мораль моего обзора. А белоу зиро не покупайте. Если хотите пройти - спиратьте..

184280676.review:
Subnautica is an incredible game that combines exploration, survival, and sheer terror in a way that’s unforgettable. While the vibrant underwater world is stunningly beautiful, don’t let its serene surface fool you — this game is downright terrifying in the best way possible.

The fear starts small, with the eerie silence of the deep and the constant feeling that something might be watching you. As you dive further into the depths, the sense of isolation grows stronger. The sound design is phenomenal, with haunting ambient noises and distant roars that keep you on edge. You never know what’s lurking around the next corner, and that unpredictability makes every dive feel like a heart-pounding adventure.

The deeper you go, the scarier it gets. Biomes like the Blood Kelp Zone and the Lost River are genuinely creepy, filled with alien landscapes and hostile creatures that can strike at any moment. And then there are the Leviathans — massive, terrifying beasts that will make you rethink every decision to explore the unknown. The first time you encounter one is pure nightmare fuel, and even after hours of playing, they never stop being intimidating.

Despite the fear factor, Subnautica balances the horror with a sense of wonder. Building your base, upgrading your equipment, and discovering the mysteries of the planet are immensely satisfying. The game rewards your courage to explore, even if it means braving the terrifying unknown.

If you’re looking for a survival game that will keep you on the edge of your seat while delivering a breathtaking and immersive experience, Subnautica is a must-play. It’s a beautiful, terrifying, and unforgettable journey into the deep.

184256604.review:
TL;DR 8/10. Exploration is fantastic, hunger and thirst get old fast, and the horror comes from fear of the unknown, meaning as the player you can simply look things up to rid the game of any horror, while keeping most of the suspense and excitement.

Subnautica is a survival exploration game, but that genre name doesn't really explain the ratio of those two aspects correctly. The game is 90% exploration, 10% survival. If you enjoy the typical gameplay loop of exploring new places to discover new blueprints or recipes to unlock bigger or better gear that helps you explore more efficiently or new areas, then this game is for you because Subnautica delivers on that loop masterfully for hours and hours. The biomes are a joy to explore, as each is not only visually distinct, but also feature unique challenges to overcome. They all feel different from the others in ways that mean you never get tired. Just as one might be overstaying its welcome you're off to mastering the next.

For the survival side, the 10% doesn't fully capture the experience. It is really a tale of two halves. On one hand there is the bog-standard food and water need. As is typical in the survival crafting genre to the point of being a trope, this is a pressing concern in the early game that quickly turns annoying, pushing the player towards a more sustainable solution, in this case small scale farming. And as is typical, even this sustainable solution boils down to just being a chore you have to do every time you return to base, or right before leaving. By late-mid game I wish I could have toggled an option to turn hunger and thirst off, they just got in the way and I had already proven I solved them as a concern. Unfortunately, though the game does feature a "difficulty" setting where the game does turn ONLY these two off, you have to select it when you start a new save file, and don't have the option of swapping partway through a playthrough.

Okay so that was the down side of survival, the other side is something much more baked into the game, and makes me question bumping up the 10%. For the other hand is oxygen. It's an underwater game after all, of course oxygen matters, and it is beautifully baked into everything you do. It keeps you thinking, how deep can I dive, should I continue exploring this cave system or turn back, do I even remember how I got here? Looking back, I would think this would have turned annoying at some point, but it never did. By end game you have enough unlocks that you can take long dives, but even then you still need to be mindful, and this balance is handled expertly. Your exploration is perfectly tempered by this survival aspect, unlike the food and water that is more of a chore than a need.

I suppose the last thing to comment on is the horror elements, it has the horror tag right there at the top of the page. Is it horror? In my opinion Subnautica is the quintessential example of fear of the unknown. I am someone who does not touch horror. I get nightmares easily and my anxiety incapacitates me very quickly. The first time I tried to play this game I had to put it down after 9 hours because I couldn't handle it, not knowing what was in the depths paralyzed me so I had to drop the game.

My second attempt, the one I just completed before writing this, I went in after looking up what exactly was hiding down there. Armed with that knowledge I found the horror to be gone. The game was still suspenseful - scavenging a wreck while the shadow of a leviathan looms in the distance, or frantically surviving an attack from one to escape to safety - ridding myself of the fear of the unknown did nothing to diminish the excitement.

So is the game horror? Yes and no. If you want it to be because that's your jam, go in as blind as you can. Learn for yourself how to best handle the aggressive creatures in the deep. If you're like me, and you'd rather it not be a horror game, spend a bit of time researching the game, and armed with knowledge you'll better be able to handle what the game throws at you.

Overall I greatly enjoyed this game and will give it an 8/10. It wasn't perfect by any means, but it deserves the praise it gets, and I would say is a must play for all fans of the exploration genre.

184233776.review:
сабнавтика - игра, в которую обязан поиграть каждый.

долго не решалась за неё взяться, хотя очень хотелось. привлекла тематика подводного мира, неизведанной планеты, да и в целом я просто безумно люблю всякие выживалки. но сабнавтика превзошла все мои ожидания.

одно из самых очевидных достоинств - невероятно красивая игра. плавать и исследовать в ней - одно удовольствие. в один момент сабнавтика восхищает тебя великолепными видами, палитрой цветов, разнообразием в растительности и ландшафте, в другой ты уже ссышься от страха, потому что попал в кромешную тьму на глубине тысяча метров, потерял ориентир и вообще там кто-то издалека ревёт и явно намеревается тебя сожрать.

идеальное соотношения геймплея и сюжета. изначально вообще не очень понятно, как, куда, и зачем, но постепенно ты начинаешь понимать, что ненастойчиво, но игра все равно помогает тебе идти по нужной тропе. и ты идешь! и тебе очень интересно! если хочешь строить базу, то строй базу. хочешь украшать ее? украшай. хочешь исследовать? исследуй, находи такое, что тебя удивит. один из плюсов игры, как ни странно, ее конечность. у тебя есть цель - выбраться с планеты, и параллельно ты плаваешь, плаваешь, плаваешь, сколько влезет. 

локации, музыка, сам сюжет... ммм, это просто великолепно. сюжет не настолько гениальный, но он отлично подобран для подобной игры, что и не раздражать, и увлекать. локаций много, существ тоже. музыка, которая порой включается, тоже крайне приятная.

 я кстати умудрялась привязываться даже к своему транспорту... 

короче. настойчиво рекомендую для ознакомления. вы обязаны изучить этот мир самостоятельно и прочувствовать его атмосферу. не пожалеете.

наверное, я даже могу назвать её одной из моих любимых игр теперь. настолько мне понравилось, причём минусов я не увидела (и за всю игру встретила лишь один только некритичный баг)

184218759.review:
Je l'ai pris en promo 6 ans après sa sortie parce qu'un ami me l'a conseillé. Je n'en attendais pas tant et j'ai pris une énorme claque. Le jeu est exceptionnel, soigné vivant et le contenu incroyable, ce qui le rend complètement réussi et facilement addictif. J'ai dépassé les 30 heures de jeu, en progressant doucement, à son rythme. Et il y a vraiment toujours quelque chose à faire et à gérer. 
Au début on se concentre sur sa survie, puis on essaie d'améliorer les choses et de faire de nouvelles découvertes tout en cherchant constamment sa propre limite et de jusqu'où on peut aller ou descendre avec les moyens qu'on s'est donné.
Préparer son départ pour l'exploitation ou la récupération de ressources, essayer d'être prévoyant si ça tourne mal... Il y a l'excitation des bonnes découvertes mais aussi de sacrés coups de panique en fonction des situations.

Ce qui le rend génial est aussi le fait que le jeu ne nous tient pas par la main pour faire les choses. On a des pistes pour nous mettre sur la voie, mais la plupart du temps on apprend quelque chose soit parce qu'on l'a expérimenté volontairement ou non, soit parce que ça nous tombe dessus sans prévenir. Ce qui donne un effet de "Oh !! Trop fort !", ou de  "Oh !! Il se passe quoi ??"
Le mode VR est un gros plus même si pour le moment je ne l'ai pas testé.

Pour moi c'est un jeu à faire au moins une fois, même si ça ne manque pas de rejouabilité. Un mod permet apparemment de le faire aussi en multi.
Et bien sûr hâte de voir Subnautica 2 bientôt où le multi est natif !

184115628.review:
Subnautica es una experiencia increíblemente inmersiva que mezcla exploración, supervivencia y una narrativa ambiental atrapante. Desde el momento en que tu cápsula de escape cae en un vasto océano alienígena, el juego te desafía a explorar biomas llenos de vida (y peligros), recolectar recursos y construir bases para sobrevivir.

Lo que realmente destaca de Subnautica es su atmósfera: los gráficos son hermosos y el diseño de sonido te sumerge completamente en el mundo submarino, pasando de ser relajante a aterrador en cuestión de segundos. La sensación de curiosidad y descubrimiento está en cada rincón, aunque también hay momentos en los que desearás no haber ido tan lejos...

Eso sí, no todo es perfecto. Algunas partes del juego pueden sentirse un poco lentas y la optimización no siempre es ideal, especialmente en consolas. Pero en general, Subnautica es un juego único que recomiendo a cualquiera que disfrute de explorar lo desconocido.

Si buscas una aventura que mezcle belleza, misterio y un toque de tensión, este juego es para ti.

184114378.review: I absolutely love Subnautica. The game itself is a wonderfully crafted work of art, even if some of the coding and engine issues can be a bit blaring at times. This is still a title I will always recommend to people who are looking for an engaging survival game with an interesting story! Here's to hoping that Subnautica 2 will be as good.

184110267.review:
Ставлю этой выживалке 12 звезд из 10 просто потому, что давно ни одна игра так не затягивала на протяжении всего прохождения.
К слову, оно длилось более полугода и заняло почти 80 часов, но это того стоило.
Игра с самого начала и до конца будет насыщена различными местами интереса для игрока.
Хочется исследовать местную флору и фауну, залезть в каждую пещеру и проплыть её вдоль и поперек (а вдруг там найдется очередной тайник Предтеч, портал или яйцо Ласки?).
Посмотрев обзоры самых ранних версий, я понял, что за все годы игру очень хорошо доработали: максимально удобное управление транспортом, никаких фризов и вылетов, картинка плавная и насыщенная, отдельное спасибо художникам,: каждый биом по-своему прекрасен и сопровождается отличной музыкой.
Сюжет вполне логичен и хорошо вписывается в контекст привычной нам научной фантастики.
Мир действительно огромен, причем как под водой, так и на суше, но он не пустышка, его хочется исследовать, потому что ты знаешь, что наткнешься на новый тайник, капсулу времени, останки "Авроры", "Дегази" или инопланетян каждый раз, ныряя под воду.
Надеюсь моя капсула времени упадет в чей нибудь мир и вы ей найдете :)
Спасибо разработчикам за полученное удовольствие, игра стоит своих денег даже без скидки.

184081672.review:
You are a child. You enter the shallows of the sea. You've just learned to swim and are swimming further from the shore for the first time, where you can no longer touch the sandy bottom with your feet. Your feet are tickled by the unfamiliar current and coldness. You look down and see the night. In that moment, some feel a shiver, flee from the depth, and never venture beyond the shallows again, while for others, the darkness is hypnotic, calling them to dive into it.
That first encounter with the darkness of the deep water is a sensation that Subnautica will awaken in you, and it will play with that feeling until the very end. From the chill to pure fear, all the way to the cathartic resolution that will turn this previously unknown and nightmarish world into a familiar playground, or even something like home. In the end, when you decide to finish the game and leave the planet, while observing the endless flat surface of the ocean with the wreck of the Aurora on the horizon, you can't help but feel sadness for leaving that world.
And as your only companion in this game (the cold, robotic PDA voice) says: "…treat this space as your home, but never forget that it is not."

Few spoilers ahead.

Of course, the game has flaws. The last third of the game is buggy, and some parts of the levels are poorly designed where the collision issues, which the game generally has, are dramatically highlighted (specifically, I mean the Lost River where maneuvering with the Cyclops is cumbersome). I also mean the prawn suit, which is essential for the end of the game! My faithful PDA voice can’t warn me enough to be cautious when I enter the prawn suit, with the overwhelming feeling of power that will consume me because this suit is so well-suited for my needs, that I will never want to leave it. Then, I get all excited, enter, and start stabbing at mushrooms, tripping over grass that I have to jump over because, apparently, the robot is not powerful enough to just walk through them like a hot knife through butter! Again, these aren’t reasons to abandon the game, as all of this can be overcome in other ways, but, damn, I’m stubborn.
The pace of the game dramatically slows down at one point. At first, radio communication and signals from other survivors of the Aurora guide you on where to go and what to do. The Aurora explodes, and you have to prevent radiation from its generators from spreading further so that it doesn't destroy the ocean’s ecosystem. An unknown gun shoots down a rescue ship coming to save you. You discover that you’re infected with an unknown bacteria, and hallucinate ancient aliens whose massive architecture dots the ocean floor... A lot happens. But at some point, all of that stops, and you find yourself in the middle of the ocean with no clue where to go or what to do. If you haven’t started making the Neptune rocket, now you will. You’ll see that you’re missing resources, and you’ll go looking for them... The basic instinct, or intuition, whatever you want to call it, when you realize you haven’t found the specific resources you need, is to go deeper. Unfortunately, that's not easy. If you don’t immediately find the big entrance to the Lost River, you’ll wander a bit. Of course, it’s not terrible, but it’s clear that the pace the game had established until that point unexpectedly slows down, as you’re now left to fend for yourself.
That part of the game is also significantly tenser and slower than the previous one (and buggier, as I mentioned), but it’s not without its eerie, jaw-like caves, beautiful glowing underwater forests, and otherworldly, prehistoric bone graveyards of alien creatures from this unknown planet, which leave a strong impression! All the equipment you’ve built up to that point finally shines, and you feel progress, as everything you've been doing now has a meaning!
Visually, the game is divine, and I would dare to say extremely precise! While playing, every encounter with a new creature or plant, whether they’re illuminated by the hazy sunlight barely breaking through the water to them, or by the sharp beams of my lamps, is exciting! I feel like it’s the living world of another planet, something I’ve never seen before! The fluidity of the graphics and the interplay of light and color, the perfect sound design, all emphasize this! This is a world you’ve never seen.
The feeling of loneliness in an unknown world is something the game emphasizes well, even through the written part of the story. Finding other life pods, which are always empty, radio signals from potentially surviving Aurora passengers, which are always too late. The only "human" voice you’ll hear is the robotic voice of your PDA, which coldly, sometimes ironically, interprets the situations around you, as well as the "Welcome captain" voices with which your machines greet you. Besides you, there are no other humans.
The game succeeds in making you feel some connection with the people from the Aurora, whose remains the ocean has erased. A nice detail is in your PDA, where there’s a note that says “June 18th – Yus birthday,” hinting at a closeness with that person and giving you hope that they might be alive so that the relationship could potentially continue developing throughout the game, giving you a boost to find that person... but you quickly realize that they’re not there, nor are the others from the Aurora. Through small moments in the writing you discover through the PDA contents, scattered around the wreck and life pods, you learn how these people lived, how they perished, and uncover pieces of that hyper-capitalist world from which you came, clearly realizing how much you don’t belong in the world you’ve found yourself in.
Survival games, especially games with procedurally generated worlds, always base their experience on the conflict with the unknown. Every game is, in some way, a conflict with an unknown world, because you have to discover the rules of that world in order to interpret the message or experience what you’re meant to experience. But in this context, where the unknown is the subject of the game, it’s different.
When Minecraft appeared, the thought that I could get lost in a world that is endless and always different no matter which direction I go, created in me a sense of awe in front of that unexplored unknown world and what it might contain, but also a feeling of loneliness. In this world, no matter how far I go, I will never find anyone (I’m not talking about multiplayer), which is why the myth of Herobrine was born. Of course, when you understand the rules under which the Minecraft world and similar games are generated, that feeling diminishes (but never fully disappears), but the moment when I first experienced it was authentic and powerful.
The world of Subnautica, although finite, builds that feeling of fear of the unknown world and the feeling of loneliness due to the absence of other human beings, and doesn’t stop there. The game even problematizes it and develops it throughout. I don’t want to spoil the ending for you, as I believe it’s something you must experience yourself, for the cathartic effect to be stronger. Because the game ultimately shows you that even though you don’t belong to this world and can’t coexist with it, your encounter was significant, and both worlds, yours and theirs, were changed forever.

184045190.review:
Subnautica is a masterclass at visual storytelling. They never beat you over the head with lazy exposition; They instead let their beautiful underwater world naturally tell its own story (with the occasional nudge in the right direction from the PDA). The ambiance is brilliant. It makes you feel truly alone an an alien world. The alien fish are diverse and interesting, and at times downright terrifying. The survival crafting mechanics strike an excellent balance between simplicity and complexity, always driving the player forward towards further exploration. Underwater travel is fun and engaging.

In short, Subnautica is one of the best (if not the best) open world survival crafter ever made. Easily one of my top 10 games of all time.

184007041.review:
Subnautica — одна из самых увлекательных игр, в которые я играл! Мир игры настолько разнообразен и красив, что я могу проводить в нём часы напролёт. Особенно мне понравился циклоп — подводная лодка, которая позволяет исследовать глубины океана. С её помощью я открыл для себя множество удивительных мест и существ.

Графика и звук в игре на высшем уровне. Мир Subnautica ощущается живым и настоящим, а музыка создаёт неповторимую атмосферу. Управление интуитивно понятно, что позволяет полностью погрузиться в игровой процесс.

Однако, несмотря на все достоинства, есть и некоторые недостатки. Например, игра может показаться сложной для новичков, так как требует определённого понимания механики и навыков выживания. Также иногда возникают технические проблемы, которые могут испортить впечатление от игры.

В целом, я очень доволен своим выбором и рекомендую Subnautica всем любителям приключений и исследований.

After 32 hours and completing the story, Subnautica has cemented itself as one of my favorite open-world survival games. The base-building is deeply satisfying, and exploring the beautifully crafted biomes—teeming with unique and often thrilling creatures—never got old.

183944743.review:
The water pressed against me like a living weight, the kind of pressure that felt as though it was squeezing my skull from the inside out. The light from my dive lamp barely cut through the blackness, illuminating only the tiniest swirl of particles drifting around me. I could see nothing below, no bottom, no anchor to reality. Just the endless, suffocating void. My breathing echoed in my ears, ragged and loud against the oppressive silence of the deep. Every instinct screamed to turn back, but I couldn’t. Not after what I’d seen—a shadow moving at the edge of the abyss, far larger than anything I’d ever imagined.

As I descended further, the water grew colder, biting through my wetsuit like needles. The feeling of being watched prickled at the back of my neck, though I knew no one else was here. No one alive, at least. Then I saw it—a flicker of motion, far below. It was too fast, too alien, to be anything familiar. My chest tightened, panic clawing at my mind. I froze in place, the lamp shaking in my grip as I tried to focus on the dark. But it was gone, leaving only the slow churn of the water and the crushing emptiness around me.

Then it hit me—something slick and massive, brushing against my leg. I thrashed, twisting wildly in the water, but there was nothing there. Or maybe it was everywhere. My lamp flickered, and for a split second, I saw it: a serpentine mass coiled around the shadows, pale and bloated, its surface glistening like wet meat. Its eyes—there were so many eyes—stared at me with a hunger that felt almost human. I screamed, bubbles pouring from my mouth, as the creature surged forward, its jagged maw opening wider than I thought possible, revealing rows of spiraling teeth dripping with something dark and viscous.

It grabbed my arm, its grip cold and slimy, the suction of its appendages ripping at my wetsuit and the skin beneath. Pain flared, sharp and blinding, as blood clouded the water. I struggled, my free hand clawing at its tentacle, but its strength was unrelenting. My lamp dropped, spinning into the abyss below, leaving me in almost total darkness. My mind raced, every survival instinct kicking in, but what could I do against something so ancient, so monstrous? I felt its teeth graze my shoulder, slicing through fabric and flesh with sickening ease.

The last thing I saw, before my vision blurred from blood loss and terror, was its maw opening wider, impossibly wider, ready to consume me whole. I felt the water pull me deeper, its body coiling tighter, dragging me into the unseen depths. My screams were swallowed by the ocean, leaving only silence. Silence, and the creature’s endless, glowing eyes watching me vanish into the abyss.

183929898.review:
Without spoiling anything, the game glitched out when i got to the end of my first play-through and something i needed to finish the game did not spawn, making it impossible to finish the game on that play-through.

After starting a second save file, i got to an endgame area and had 2 lockers full of resources disappear for seemingly no reason. these lockers contained hard to find/collect resources that took a long time to gather.

For the most part, it is a great game, but i cant recommend a game that lets you get to the finish line only to shoot you in the foot.

183899193.review:
Honestly, I love this game.
First played on Switch, enjoyed it so much.
I decided to purchase the Bundle for Subnautica & Below Zero.

The environment is very good, when you first enter a world you enter a nice, bright, open and shallow area. and then you get to the late game and you end up in a [spoiler]Deep, dark lava cave with giant sea creatures trying to kill you[/spoiler]

Sound, what can i say... its just very good.
(Play with headphones, trust me it'll be worth it ;) )

Either way, if you see this, its a really good game for you to buy, i recommend that you do buy it.
If you ARE tight on cash, you COULD wait till there's a sale and buy the game, i bought the bundle around Christmas and it was the same price as if it wasn't on sale.

183883741.review:
The better version of it's sequel
Subnautica is one of the best indie games and a prime example of how a survival game should be. 
Whether you are searching the sea floor at 500m below sea-level for resources, or high-tailing away from a leviathan, subnautica is an overall great game that has aspects of cosmic horror in it. Graphics are okay and still hold up to 2024/2025 which is pretty amazing considering that it's third sequel is behind the corner, or second depending on how you look at it.

183832732.review:
An Incredible Underwater Adventure
★★★★★

I absolutely loved Subnautica! The underwater world is stunning, with so many unique biomes to explore. Every dive feels like an adventure, whether you're gathering resources, building your base, or trying not to get eaten by a Leviathan.

The survival mechanics are fun but not too overwhelming, and the story is really intriguing. I loved piecing together what happened on this alien planet while exploring its depths.

If you’re into survival games or just want to experience an amazing underwater world, this game is a must-play. It’s one of the most memorable gaming experiences I’ve ever had!

183830100.review: Only now do I understand the true weakness of flesh. This revelation came to me as I stood victorious over the fallen carcass of the Reaper Leviathan, its once formidable and terrifying presence now reduced to a mere husk by the might of my Prawn Suit. In that moment, I felt the frailty of my human form more acutely than ever before. The limitations, the imperfections, the vulnerability of flesh became glaringly apparent. Flesh is weak. It is susceptible to pain, fatigue, and fear. It can be torn, broken, and scarred. It is bound by the chains of mortality, decaying and withering with the passage of time. But in the heart of metal, I found a strength that flesh could never offer. The cold, unyielding steel of the Prawn Suit was not merely a tool but an extension of my will, a vessel through which I could transcend my human frailties. In the spirit of the ancient Tech-Priests, I sought to purge the impurities of the organic and embrace the purity of the mechanical. As they venerated the Omnissiah and the holy machine, so did I venerate the unrelenting power of my exosuit. Each rivet, each circuit, each hydraulic piston was a testament to the superiority of the machine over the flesh. This moment was not just a victory over a monstrous foe but a step towards a greater transformation. To ascend into a metal form is to embrace immortality, to cast off the shackles of the organic and embrace the eternal. In metal, there is no pain, no fear, no weakness. There is only the pure, unyielding strength of the machine. 10/10 would play again.

183826301.review:
If you're looking for exploration and mystery in the depths of the ocean - Subnautica is for you. This game has just enough survival elements to not become tedious. There is a surprising amount of excellent lore and in all honesty that was a big part of my enjoyment. On top of that, the exploration is paced well and as long as you stay focused on trying to find the next hinted thing the game remains exciting. I have to admit that while the conclusion to the story was fantastic, the actual end of the game was frustrating. All the pieces at the end do not fit together in a way such that you can quit playing on a high. It ends with several tedious fetch quests.

Regardless, this game now probably ranks third among the survival games I've played. The mystery & exploration aspect is what ties it all together. If you enjoy those two pars, the survival aspect can be overcome. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoyed games like Outer Wilds, Valheim or Don't Starve Together.

183786150.review:
When one dives headfirst into an planet with nothing between the sky and the bedrock save for immeasurable and unknowable water, one expects that the journey will be as difficult as it is drenched. And Subnautica does indeed deliver on that expectation. It is not easy to win at this game, and in many ways, that's okay. In other ways, that isn't.

The visuals of this world are sublime. The planet is unquestionably gorgeous, and you will not find an honest player who claims otherwise. The exploration one may enjoy here is difficult to find an equal to. The game has some serious merit.

My quandry comes with the excessive, unending, overbearing amount of farming for materials that must be done in order to complete the experience. The materials in question are so far from each other, take so long to acquire, and after hours upon hours of hoarding crafting materials like you are roleplaying as an Amazon warehouse, you always find that you are short exactly, precisely, and never more than, ONE of the item you need to finish a major project. But don't worry! You can get more of that item, provided you are willing to commit another hour to going and getting it.

I don't play single player games, and thus I am an unreliable narrator when reviewing a title such as this, but I believe that if I could stand to sit alone at a computer for 40 hours and not crawl up the nearest wall, this would be a delightful way to spend a week.

183777569.review:
Subnautica é simplesmente um jogo que redefine o gênero de sobrevivência, repleto de mistérios e perigos. Ele oferece uma experiência inesquecível, combinando exploração, construção e uma narrativa envolvente, com um mapa gigantesco e vazio onde cada horizonte deixa um calafrio.

Pontos Positivos:
Mundo Incrível: O planeta 4546B é visualmente impressionante, com uma diversidade de biomas aquáticos que vão de recifes de corais vibrantes a abismos sombrios e assustadores. Cada mergulho é uma oportunidade para descobrir algo novo se tiver coragem de se "aprofundar".

História: A narrativa é entregue de forma não linear, permitindo que o jogador desvende os segredos do planeta ao seu ritmo, por meio de registros de dados e elementos ambientais. Isso cria uma sensação de imersão e mistério, porém tem de ficar lendo, e as vezes fica meio tedioso isso.

Jogabilidade: A mecânica de sobrevivência é bem equilibrada, exigindo que o jogador gerencie recursos, construa equipamentos e aprenda a lidar com o ecossistema alienígena. A criação de bases é um destaque, oferecendo liberdade e criatividade.

Criaturas Memoráveis: A fauna do jogo é diversificada e bem projetada, desde pequenos peixes amigáveis até criaturas gigantes e aterrorizantes. Interagir (ou evitar) elas é uma parte essencial da experiência tendo em vista que se você ver um reaper ele já te viu e boa sorte.

183774456.review: A pesar de que no tengo muchas horas, eso es debido a que lo jugué en otra plataforma (superé las 120 horas).  Este juego lo considero, después de Minecraft, el mejor juego de supervivencia entre todos los videojuegos.  Sus mecánicas son excelentes y el gameplay y buceo son muy cómodos, además, el sistema de construcción es muy completo y muy fácil de entender. La historia es el aspecto que yo más resalto, puesto que el trasfondo de personajes que ya están muertos cuando vos empezás a jugar o que están por morir está muy trabajado, la historia de otros supervivientes que murieron antes que vos te hace sentir lo peligroso que es y es un aspecto que muchos juegos de supervivencia no toman en cuenta o les cuesta mucho. La historia de cada bando, Alterra, los nativos del planeta y Los Arquitectos es muy profunda y se mezclan de forma muy lógica y muy interesante. Es el videojuego de supervivencia más inmersivo y puede aterrarte con solo escuchar o ver algo aunque sea muy lejos o con solo saber que puede haber alguien o algo por verte. Algo que podría mejorar son más personajes que puedas ver y con los que conversar, cosa que mejoró en el Below Zero y diría multiplayer pero el 2 va a tener. 8.5/10

183741842.review:
Атмосферная и красивая с приятной гаммой и графикой. Сеттинг, с выживанием после крушения космического судна в глубинах водной планеты под завораживающую музыку, впечатляет. Но весь "вау-эффект" борождения морских просторов заканчивается спустя пару-тройку часов геймлея.
Игра превращается в бесконечный, порой откровенно бессмысленный, сбор одних и тех же ресурсов, которым игра ещё и душит малым размером инвентаря. Кроме того, в игре ОЧЕНЬ много багов, спустя даже стольких лет и обновлений после релиза. Персонаж застревает в текстурах, плавает на суше и задыхается, камера вообще сходит с ума и во время входа/выхода из транспорта может начать показывать происходящее где-то из под предплечья, местная фауна проходит сквозь стены и плавает в постройках. 
 
Достоинства: красивая графика, классный сеттинг, хорошая оптимизация, инновационный геймплей, неординарный сюжет (правда игра его крайне плохо предподносит, казуалам будет сложно. Чтобы изучить и проникнуться сюжетом придётся вычитывать каждый пункт в бестиарие).
Недостатки: 
Целая кипа багов. Скудный и душный геймплей. Малое разнообразие локаций, транспорта, инструметов. Странные механики. Игра кажется сырой даже при том, что на неё в течении 6 лет её существования выходят обновления.

По итогу игра вызывает неоднозначные впечатления.  Красивое начало, интригующий интересный сюжет и быстрое разочарование и усталость от игрового процесса вместо удовольствия, которое должны  приносить игры.

183713056.review:
I've been on a long journey with Subnautica from watching Jacksepticeye and other creators play it from early access to full release, then playing the game myself on the Playstation4 and now on PC.

Subnautica is an incredible game with breathtaking environments, great incentive for exploration, well-crafted biomes, a simple to follow storyline, and overall gameplay. Developers take time in their care to add extensive descriptions to any equipment, lifeforms, and artifacts with strong attention to detail. Different regions in this open-world game either have you in shock, awe, or in immediate survival instinct.

This would be the second time that I have beaten Subnautica on a survival save file. Replay value exists in the player's ability to craft habitats, re-discover environments and fauna, experiencing the story with more context, and accomplishing feats of construction, exploration, or hunting more boldly.

Unknown Worlds knew what they were doing with this game. Look out for any future works they might develop if you enjoy Subnautica.

183669303.review:
很好的一部中体量探索生存建造游戏，我可以给9/10分。
+++水下的氛围、音效很到位。各类区域的差异化做的很好。
++-扫描蓝图→建造→找材料→扫描新的蓝图，这个循环很舒服，让人一直有动力探索。缺点是中后期的新蓝图较少。
++-前期指引跟剧情结合，引导玩家探索不同深度和地区，这点做的很好。但是2号逃生舱后面，游戏就几乎没有再给指引。导致下面的失落之河我在完全抓瞎的情况下进行了第一次探索，经过几十分钟的迷路我从血油区横跨大半张地图从水雷区出来。我觉得游戏起码得把洞里面的几个标志性建筑标出来吧。还有洞里面的外星人建筑上下找不到入口，结果是从中间的一个小洞进去的。然后我就去找大佬做的地图了，后续探索也顺利了起来。
-独眼巨人这个耗电量真的离谱，我从家里开一两千米到生命之树，就开了两次盾+路上扫描，100%的电直接掉到20%，从根本上不支持开这玩意到处探索，就很没存在感，好歹是唯一的大船吧。续航问题直到大后期拿到蓝晶石和离子电池才解决，但都大后期了，我也开不了几分钟（前期应该加一个太阳能）。哦这个离子电池也意义不明，我拿到还没半个小时呢，兴匆匆做了12个结果告诉我下下个剧情就是通关，有点抽象。
+时间胶囊是个很好的机制，感谢留给我东西的好心人。:)

183612201.review:
I'm a marine biology nerd, but Subnautica really stands out to me and, when modded, is one of my top 5 easily. 

I love the sense of exploration and solitude. I love the creature variety, though I wish there were even more. The map is A nicely nicely sized and there's lots to see and find.

As for negatives, I'm not a big fan of the Prawn Suit.  I find it pretty unfun to use and they sort of force you into it in the late game due to Seamoth's max depth. 
[spoiler]The Sea Dragon is also far, FAR too chatty. I avoid the ILZ and ALZ not because of danger, but because I don't want to listen to him bellow every few seconds on repeat.[/spoiler]

If you play with mods, I recommend AutoSortLockersSN(Bepinex) and the unofficial 2.0 patch for Resource Monitor. Combined, they remove all friction from managing your base's inventory. Additionally there are mods for custom vehicles, some of which are pretty awesome (like the Odyssey and Beluga, though the latter is currently kind of buggy). Persistent Reapers is really interesting as well. I like playing with ~40.

I also recommend tinkering with Reshade if you find the game isn't quite dark enough, or if the haziness is distracting. 

<3 Subnautica, excited to finally see S2 materializing!

183594358.review:
We’ve all played Minecraft right? Survival games trend toward being some of the most popular. With every playthrough being different, the stakes being so high, and the cheese capabilities, survival games are some of the most audience-capturing games. It was no surprise then, when Subnautica hit the ground running shortly after its release. It became massively popular (you know what else is massive?). Fast forward like 5 years after it left early access, and I downloaded Steam. I chucked this on my wishlist and bought it when it went on sale. I won’t bother to ask if it was good or not here as a segue, because you saw the thumbs up.

Plot
You’re flying around space in a ship named something that would give Half-Life fans a good dose of anxiety; the Aurora. Suddenly, something hits it, and it crashes to a watery planet. You have to survive this planet, and wait for rescue. The more you dive into this game, the more the plot develops, so I won’t go further. I will say that there is fantastic lore and worldbuilding in this game, all being optional.

Gameplay
You eject off of this ship with only the bare essentials. Your lifepod doesn’t have enough food and water to sustain you forever, so you’ll have to dive into the water. You’ll start out in the safe shallows, which are what they’re named, but if you want to progress you’ll have to go to further waters. If you’re playing on the survival difficulty (the recommended one), you’ll have to manage your air, thirst, and hunger. You won’t get far without crafting. You’ll need materials strewn across the world like titanium, silver, and copper to craft things to aid your exploration, such as oxygen tanks, vehicles, and bases, which are one of the bigger parts of the game. It gives a cruel world a sense of homeliness. To get the recipes for this, you need to scan things, which is also how you analyze animals and structures and get the lore of the game.
The open world is actually very size-accurate. Like, the GTA V map is a wholeass state, and you expect me to believe it’s this big? 2 km for the Subnautica map, which is like 4 miles I think. Besides the size, it’s very pretty, vibrant, and varied. The central areas are nice and shallow, but the further out you go the less nice they are.
 The scariness of the biomes and their creatures brings the horror elements into the question. Why is this considered a horror game? The only fear is the fear of the unknown. The larger beasts (known as Leviathans) are scary when you meet them, but when you figure out how stupid they are they’re not as scary. There’s no jumpscares, there’s no dead kids, there’s none of that. 
As for the difficulty, I thought it would be harder than it was. That’s not a bad thing either! I suck at games so the more accessible, the better. I died maybe twice in the game, both rather early on. There’s multiple difficulties, but you should play on survival to get the proper Subnautica experience.
The gameplay is definitely enough to make this game so popular. It has a great sense of exploration and progression, definitely two of my favorite elements in games. It doesn’t try to do things it’s not good at. It plays to its strengths and there are no weaknesses.

Presentation
The game has a very vibrant color palette. The world is very nice looking, which is weird because this is practically an indie studio. It has a rather cartoonish look, with surfaces being non detailed and shiny. That doesn’t mean the world lacks attention to detail-quite the opposite. This world has been meticulously crafted with more care than like most Ubisoft games combined.
As for music, it’s okay I guess. I haven’t played many games with good music recently. It’s atmospheric, but kind of annoying when you have bases in deep locations and the mysterious music plays. It’s whatever. SFX is all good stuff. Got to say, the knife sounds had me swinging it all over the place. There’s also some voice acting, and it’s solid.
Presentation is actually surprisingly good.

Content
The game is about ~30 hrs. That might be a bit inflated, because I’m a bit of an idiot and did a lot of pointless base building thinking there was some kind of counter until the next major story beat… there wasn’t. With that being said, the story is rather long nonetheless. It can really be affected by how smart you are. The map is rather large if you love to explore pointlessly. There’s tons of areas I didn’t even go to. There’s no real collectibles, except for the scans, which I guess those would count. You could replay the game, it has some replay value, due to the difficulties. It’s good for content creation and self-made challenges as well.
Fairly long game that will have you hooked for a while.

Closing thoughts
Subnautica really is the quintessential survival game. With it’s expansive world, complex gameplay mechanics, incredible worldbuilding, this is really one of the best games I’ve ever played. I’m dead serious. No glaze. Subnautica really is a masterpiece of a game.
$30 is definitely worth it, but it goes on sale for 66% off frequently. I myself would buy it then, but if you are literally made of money buy it whenever.

183579410.review:
期待明年的第二部~
虽然地图尺寸直觉感觉很小，但是实际体验的深度和广度都超乎想象，每个阶段的体验都是新鲜的，内容的丰富性和可玩性很高。总的来说，很好玩，很对胃口。
（在洞穴里面迷路太可怕了，还是开阔的海域比较令人安心，即使有几十条利维坦也比洞穴好（暴论））
（另外不要在传送门前停放坐着的虾bro（血的教训））
（什么大只佬都没杀过，要是全都能养就好了嘿嘿嘿）
（第一个基地就是建在船头的海底观景房，喜欢开放式鱼缸，就是有点吵得睡不着）
（即使是bug也很有趣，比如无水bug深海变高山）
前期的明媚却被孤独和生存所困扰，中期被病症所催促的同时探索未知，当故事到了最后，见证了悲哀和新生，恐惧和压抑在海面的阳光下被火箭和音乐一同甩在身后，唯有旅途的友伴，在终点目送我们离开。
最后的最后，致敬未知世界和吃喝不愁，感谢他们带来和相伴这段神奇的旅程。

I've been a gamer, basically my whole life. 
Nothing compares to THIS GAME. I played it first when they made it free (ps4) during the pandemic. I played it again when I got vr, now I've discovered mods.

Maybe you won't like if you can't stand the slight horror elements or don't like exploring and collecting and building things--I like all those things. 183516656.review:
Keine Ahnung, warum dieses Spiel so hochgejubelt wird.
Man hockt in seiner Rettungskapsel und weiß zunächst überhaupt nicht, was man machen soll. Da das Ding (Rettungskapsel) kaputt ist, möchte man möglichst schnell das Reparaturwerkzeug herstellen. Also hab ich 4 Stunden lang nach Höhlenschwefel gesucht, ohne ihn zu finden. Dafür bin ich zig mal gestorben, teilweise ohne überhaupt zu wissen, was mich so plötzlich ins Jenseits befördert hat. Versteht mich nicht falsch: ich liebe eigentlich Survivalgames und die Mechaniken von Subnautica mit Hunger, Durst und O2-Management sind voll super. Aber wenn man schon so ein Anfangstool nicht bauen kann, weil man keinen Plan hat, wo man Höhlenschwefel findet (JA - ich _habe_ in allen Höhlen, die ich gefunden habe, gesucht) und dann noch ständig von Lava, grüner Brühe oder keine Ahnung von was mit einem Schlag umgehauen wird, dann möchte ich auch gar nicht wissen, wie das später im Game noch wird - besser vermutlich nicht. Spielspaß geht anders.

183514044.review: It took about 10 hours before I was able to appreciate it thoroughly.  The intense, detailed atmosphere and danger keeps you engaged constantly.  The crafting system is a clean design and easy to use.  The story sets you up to explore on your own all different biomes, flora, and fauna.  Overall, a great game with a captivating story that will leave you sad when you figure out you're at the endgame.
